intro: Croton antisyphiliticus var. heterotrichus, commonly known as the African croton, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are often green with prominent veins. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry to semi-arid conditions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
